results.title: Speed of chemical change
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Iwanama Productions
results.brief_description: This film discusses the factors that affect the speed of a chemical change. Models are used to illustrate the action of oxygen on carbon to produce carbon dioxide. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Speed for thespians
results.brief_description: On a busy New York City bus a man and a woman begin to argue. Their language is florid and slightly surreal. Very soon we become aware that what we are witnessing is a scene from Russian playwright Anton Chekhov. And very soon the rushed New York commuters are captivated by the performance unfolding in front of their jaded eyes. This innovative adaptation of Chekhov is a delirious celebration of film, theatre and urban life. Nominated for an Academy Award as Best Short Fiction Drama at the 2002 Academy Awards.

results.title: Speed (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Mark Gordon and Jan De Bont
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Speech skills: using your voice effectively
results.brief_description: In a television setting, pictures projected onto a screen change to live-action examples of situations where the effective use of your voice is important. Problems that are the result of the speaker’s volume, pitch, voice quality and articulation are examined, with suggestions for overcoming them.

results.title: Speech and protest
results.brief_description: Queries the limits to freedom of speech and assembly in America in 1967. After introducing the First Amendment, three enacted sequences are presented: in the first, students in a classroom argue about the government’s foreign policies; in the second, the teacher forcefully leads the discussion, raising the question of academic freedom and the wishes of parents; the third sequence deals with an anti-war demonstration in which a threatening crowd forms, which questions the duty of the police. The film presents conflicting opinions and controversial scenes. It’s purpose: to let you find out what you think. Footage includes demonstrations for civil rights, women’s rights, African-American protest, KKK meetings.

results.title: Speech and language disorders
results.creator_credit: Queensland. Dept. of Education. Media Services
results.brief_description: A comprehensive introduction to the work of speech therapists. Looks at speech and language disorders in children, such as, poor communication and stuttering; and the problems adults face after strokes and throat cancers. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Spectrum: psychobiology - split brain (D)
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television, International Science Magazine, David Prowitt, Philip Burton and Jack Willis
results.brief_description: This informative piece is based around a doctor who experiments on animals to find out what significance each side of the brain has, thus a monkey is operated on to “split his brain”. Tests are then run to monitor the monkey’s process. Split brain people are then looked into to find out what the left and right side of the brain does. NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING IMAGES OF ANIMAL EXPERIMENTATION.

results.title: Spectacular disasters
results.brief_description: Over the decades, images of mass destruction, whether natural or human, have been captured on film and television. This video presents a compilation of some of that footage beginning with natural disasters including the 1906 San Francisco earthquake and fire, the 1913 floods in Ohio, the collapse of the Takoma Bridge in 1940 and some of the major hurricanes that have hit America over the years. It then follows on to human created disasters such as the many failed attempts at flying the skies via planes, rockets, helicopters and airships, with some amazing shots of the Hindenburg exploding. Also includes footage of the Titanic, the sinking of the Lusitania, and the dropping of the atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. There are some light-hearted moments but there are also some disturbing visions (and commentary) contained in this documentary compilation. Presented by George Takei. In English with Spanish subtitles.

results.title: Spectacular Britain
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Brock
results.brief_description: David Attenborough takes the viewer the length of Britain in one year. Some of its most beautiful countryside is shown as well as some fascinating wildlife. The gardens of Buckingham Palace are filmed for the first time.
